definitions.definition: Linear (preserving linear combinations ) in each variable .
examples: The function f ( x , y ) = x y {\displaystyle f(x,y)=xy} is bilinear , because f ( a x + b u , y ) = a f ( x , y ) + b f ( u , y ) {\displaystyle f(ax+bu,y)=af(x,y)+bf(u,y)} and f ( x , a y + b v ) = a f ( x , y ) + b f ( x , v ) {\displaystyle f(x,ay+bv)=af(x,y)+bf(x,v)} for all values.
labels: of a function in two variables
definitions.label_groups: linear algebra , of a function in two variables

definitions.definition: Of or pertaining to a Möbius transformation (type of conformal map representable as the ratio of two linear functions).

main_definition: ( linear algebra , of a function in two variables ) Linear (preserving linear combinations ) in each variable .
secondary_definitions: ( complex analysis , physics , engineering ) Of or pertaining to a Möbius transformation (type of conformal map representable as the ratio of two linear functions).
